page.title: 01THE PEASLAKE AREA
page.content: {PEASLAKE} The villages of Peaslake, Holmbury St.Mary and Abinger lie in fertile valleys on the Greensand of the richly wooded hills of South West Surrey. To the south of Peaslake is Pitch Hill rising to 800 feet with views across the Weald. While to the south of Holmbury St. Mary is Holmbury Hill - 875 feet with spectacular views to the North and South Downs. There is mixed woodland here but a great part of the area is planted with coniferous forests to which the public have access. To the north and west of the area are pockets of productive farmland. The centres of the villages are small with church, pub, garage, village schools. The village halls act as a focal point for most community activities and a wide range of
